website_summaries.verdict: This is an impressive and easy-to-use keyboard with a long battery life, slim and compact design, and expansive wireless range.
pros: Wide compatibility, working with Windows 7, 8, 10, or later
Batteries are conveniently included, lasting up to 18 months
We love the built-in touchpad for all-in-one use
cons: Touchpad isn't quite as sensitive to the touch as those on laptops

customer_reviews.title: I use it to control my Raspberry Pi 3 (Model B) and it works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: It is very comfortable to use on the bed, It works on two AA batteries that are already included. It is smaller than your ordinary keyboard, but large enough not to press two keys at a time. The trackpad (or "mouse") is as good as any PC laptop on the market. I use it to control my Raspberry Pi 3 (Model B) and it works perfectly by just pluggin in the USB receiver, no need to download additional software or drivers. The only CON on this keyboard is that I couldn't find where to store the USB receiver on the keyboard (the hole near the batteries that Logitech puts on its mouses).
customer_reviews.author: J. CarlosTop Contributor: Raspberry Pi

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic ! ! !
customer_reviews.text: Great product ! I own several K400 plus and the older K400. Over 1 year of battery life at many hours a day use.K400 plus vs. K400: The newer version feels more rugged with better quick key layout.Mouse pad works seamless .I can not give it a 5 star rating as the older version's print is much bolder and easier to see in dim light.Neverless I still recommend this product.Thanks Logitech for another quality product at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: skipper

customer_reviews.title: The mouse stopped working within 33 days
customer_reviews.text: I had an old K400 which I loved and used for years. Alas, the mouse gave out after years. When I replaced it with this new one. I noticed everything was cheaper and worse than the old one. The mouse was oddly plasticey and sticks to your finger like a cheap laptop from 2006's trackpad. I suppose the bright side is I didn't have to deal with it for long. The mouse crapped out after 33 days of EXTREMELY light use as a keyboard for use on a TV.
customer_reviews.author: Toska

customer_reviews.title: Out of the box, it didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, it didn't work; I believe I may have received a faulty transmitter. Spent many hours on the Logitech website trouble shooting. Nothing worked. Would be happy to change my review if Logitech reaches out to help.
customer_reviews.author: M. Divine

customer_reviews.title: These are kinda cheep.
customer_reviews.text: These are kinda cheep. I was surprised the price was so low when purchasing it. I wanted a product like this for a PC that I hooked up to my TV in my living room. I like having the touch pad and a small keyboard. The problem is it keeps losing the signal. I keep replacing the batteries hoping that is the issue but it is not getting better. I wish I had bought a little better quality. update: I am giving up on this after a few months. I can't get it to work reliabily and I'm tired of trying to fix this. I like the form factor but my keyboard is just unreliable. I'm looking for a replacment.
customer_reviews.author: Ken325

customer_reviews.title: Poor keyboard and poor touch-pad sensitivity.
customer_reviews.text: I'm amazed at the 5 star reviews for this!? I'm usually fan of Logitech devices but this one was a glaring exception. The plastic was flimsy and flexed when typing. The keys had little travel. The mouse pad had such poor sensitivity that I had to crank the sensitivity bar all the way up in Windows settings to make it usable. Even then it wasn't all that accurate or good. Look elsewhere!
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: CARP
customer_reviews.text: and I don't mean the fish. It's an anagram for what I really think of this product. I ended up with two of these. The first one did not come with the required chip. The second one had the chip but I could not figure out a way to make it function. The instructions written by somebody for whom English is only a theory. The online reference required me to register with a name email password etcetera as if I needed another one of those. I never could get it to work. Just respell the word carp and you will get the idea
customer_reviews.author: Rudd Bagus

customer_reviews.title: Awful product, Beware!!
customer_reviews.text: At first it seemed like a great buy. It was an easy plug-and-play situation for my PC. After a month of using it on and off, it just died. The Logitech Options app shows that its the keyboard itself and not the unifying receiver USB. The batteries kinda klunk around in the keyboard when lightly shaken which might be the issue, like a loose spring or wire, but it just doesn't work now. The whole thing feels very cheaply made so I'm really not surprised, but frustrated none the less. I'm extra salty because it decided to die a few weeks after my return date. I highly advise you to stay away from this piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Twice sent a product missing the same essential part.  Logitech looses some trust and has some ground to cover.
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea if this is a good keyboard. I've had two sent and each of them has had a missing part. 1 time can happen to the best of them. 2 times, I am generally not that lucky. Seems more likely to be poor assembly or packaging or maybe just sending out the same faulty products over and over. .
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J. Rondeau

customer_reviews.title: The volume adjustments works great if you're using your computer speaker output
customer_reviews.text: It works with my Mac! Sure it is a PC style layout board, but there are some functions that work with Mac only functions if you look them up. As in Ctrl + arrow over will take you to your next desktop. The volume adjustments works great if you're using your computer speaker output. The RF signal works excellent as well, very sensitive. Have had for over 6 months now and batteries are still strong. Only negative for me is the keyboard does not light up and it is a bit hard to type fast on, not that big a deal though for this price.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again, good for PC navigation from the couch
customer_reviews.text: I have my PC hooked to my tv and use this from the couch. It's the 2nd one I've bought. I have my first one away to a friend who needed one. It's good enough for navigating the PC, but I wouldn't use it to replace a full keyboard/mouse. It's too compact for that. The wireless range is decent. I'm about 16 feet from my PC. If I was going to be farther than 20 feet, I'd want a usb extender cable, to bring the wireless receiver closer. It's fine, but sometimes (rarely) I will get minor lag at that range. There were zero issues when under 10 feet away. Obviously, I would buy again, because I did.
customer_reviews.author: Domneth

customer_reviews.title: The USB wireless dongle is in the edge of the box!
customer_reviews.text: Bought one of these a few days ago and unlike the 2 previous generation Logitech keyboards I already have(older white colored) the USB RF connector is in the front edge of the box it ships in . Not in the small caddy built into the battery cover. So... not seeing I set up a return/replacement. My bad. They're actually excellent RF keyboards because there's no drive - Bluetooth or otherwise. Keyboard is seen as a USB HID device. The newer generation doesn't have the top left row of shorcut buttons - but I never used those anyway. Compact and convenient with a large trackpad built in. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: MPITA

customer_reviews.title: Okay for some uses, bad for others.
customer_reviews.text: I might be a little biased because I use an Apple Magic Keyboard as my "daily driver", but I would highly recommend not using this keyboard for any actual work. It's use case is for a media PC or for a gaming console. The keys feel too flimsy and the touchpad, though being multitouch, is a little awkward to use. There is a silver lining though; it is compatible with Linux, Mac, and Windows, and the wireless "lag" is almost indistinguishable from a wired keyboard and mouse. Also, the battery life is great. Don't expect this to be a keyboard for actually typing stuff on, and you will be alright.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Hixson

customer_reviews.title: !!! Attention !! The USB receiver is not in the keyboard!!!
customer_reviews.text: The USB receiver is not in the keyboard!!! It's tucked into the cardboard of the box it comes in... Right up in front. I thought I received one with it missing and was about to try and get a replacement when I finally noticed it. Very easy to miss if you're not paying attention and think it's gonna be in the unit itself!!!! I have seen allot of reviews saying the unit didn't come with a USB receiver. I think allot of those are because they didn't notice it tucked into the box. The white paper tag showing its the receiver can get smashed down and make it hard to spot.
customer_reviews.author: Ignomoly

customer_reviews.title: Best HTPC keyboard
customer_reviews.text: For years I have been buying various mini Keyboards to control the computer attached to my TV. For years I would get one brand or the other and then quickly become annoyed at the short range, short battery life, and sloppy touchpad/keyboard. So I would start searching for a new one. Then I would start over with annoyance when it arrived. I should have saved myself the hassle and bought this the first time. It is great. Solid range - anywhere in my (small) open kitchen/dining/living room. It is responsive and behaves as if it is a real keyboard. And the batteries last an exceptionally long time. This is a great keyboard for HTPCs and other livingroom computers.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Brady

customer_reviews.title: Awkward to use
customer_reviews.text: Plastic housing is durable, love the smaller keyboard and on-product touchpad but keys are too deep to use, do not register correctly. I'm a writer and wanted a wireless keyboard, upon receiving realized right away was going to be unusable. I started the return and discovered that Amazon changed to a UPS point of sale scanning return at a local UPS store. I live on an island and the one UPS store did not have that policy, did not have a box/label in past history of returns. Amazon actively blocked me from returning, hid the 'contact us' button on the sales page and order page. Waste of $25 for this writer.
customer_reviews.author: Brick ONeil

customer_reviews.title: Good but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an upgrade to my original K400. I use it to control my Windows HTPC from my sofa. Major advantages: * Uses Logitech Options instead of now-unsupported Setpoint * Full-size right shift key * Easier to use dedicate volume buttons * No more lazer-disco graphics on the touchpad * Physical mouse buttons have better positive feedback Disadvantages: * Range not quite as good as original K400 * Up/Down arrow keys are terrible * Two-finger scrolling is noticeably worse than original K400. It seems to lag, and often scrolls down dozens of pages on its own * No more dedicated power button (is now a shared function key)
customer_reviews.author: M. Durand

customer_reviews.title: Great for HTPC
customer_reviews.text: I've had a couple wireless keyboard/mouse setups in my home theater (family room), most recently Microsoft. The main problem is they don't have much range. I went with this Logitech because of the claimed longer range. Well, it really does. I can take the keyboard 25 feet away from the PC and it works fine. The other thing I like is getting rid of the mouse. This keyboard acts more like a laptop with the trackpad, and the sensitivity is just fine. A little thing I really like is the additional left mouse button on the upper left of the keyboard. It makes it really easy to drag and click (two handed) while the keyboard is on your lap.
customer_reviews.author: RocksRoad

customer_reviews.title: Much better
customer_reviews.text: I actually like this better then the recent model it replaced. Yeah!!! no more sleep mode button like model with out the yellow, plain K400. We use this on our PC media center and somebody was always bumping the sleep button (PC button, see pic). The volume keys are placed better. Batteries last forever as did the older one. The finish is less glossy then the older version which means easier to read. See picture of them side by side.
customer_reviews.author: Jane DoeTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for bad batteries
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice keyboard mouse set up. One note don't trust the batteries that come with the keyboard. One of these I ordered had defective batteries. They were brand new sealed in with the keyboard but they were dead no charge at all. I thought there was something wrong with the keyboard or the receiver at first. I troubleshot the issue for a few hours before I decided that possibly the batteries could be an issue. After replacing them with two Eneloop batteries it has been working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Nice little keyboard and mouse combo.
customer_reviews.text: While there is no scroll on the mouse pad you have to use the page up and page down. Otherwise, it's a neat little keyboard and mouse combo. The keyboard is slightly condensed but easy to get used to. The mouse pad is aprox 61mm deep X 77mm wide. The keyboard area is aprox 102mm deep X 250mm wide. The whole thing is aprox 140mm deep X 350mm wide. The thickness at the thickest point (at the top) is 21mm and at the thinnest point is 12mm. It's made out of durable plastic. It has no feet but has a slight tilt up at the top. I'm using it with the Raspberry Pi 4 and it works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Rick M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price... but you also get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't believe that a genuine Logitech wireless keyboard could be so cheap but as soon as I got it on the box I could see and feel that you also get exactly what you pay for, haha. It feels cheap and flimsy and the action of the keys is honestly horrible. I definitely would not use this the keyboard for your primary computer or to write your next great novel. But if you're going to be using this only occasionally for an HTPC or something and don't want to spend a lot of money, having a keyboard and trackpad integrated together at this price is amazing. It comes with batteries and works basically instantly, right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan H.

customer_reviews.title: Missing USB connector / too late to return
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift in late August for my fiancé. Opened it tonight for the first time to use it with our new TV. The USB needed to make it work is not in the box. I’m beyond the return date of Sept 27th. Why doesn’t Amazon allow 60 days for a return? This was a waste of money
customer_reviews.author: NKWPRH

customer_reviews.title: Great mini keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: So far I've used this with PCs running Windows 7 and 10 and my PS3 with complete success. I mainly use it to control a mini PC running Windows 10. I like the size, not too big or small. The track pad works flawlessly. Batteries included! Crazy, who does that? I've had it a few months and have not had to change the batteries yet. The listing says up to 18 months on the same batteries, we'll see. I'm cautiously optimistic about that though, many of the other reviewers have found that to be the case, so... To sum up, I'm very satisfied with this and when I'm in need of another similar keyboard I will look to Logitech first.
customer_reviews.author: J AndersonTop Contributor: Star Wars

customer_reviews.title: Logitech K400 Plus Keyboard is just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is the greatest for use on our 4K UltraHD smart tv. Got so tired of using the tv remote to oh-so-slowly type in passwords and search strings for movies and shows. This keyboard immediately connected to the smart tv (Samsung) and we can move the cursor with the arrow buttons, type in any alphanumeric characters, and even use the touchpad to acknowledge questions on the smart tv. I also like the fact that there is a slide switch on the side of the keyboard to power on/off the device to save the batteries when we're not using it. Great price and a very handy device! You've got to get one of these.
customer_reviews.author: RugerDan

customer_reviews.title: Great, all in one, compact keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this for an indoor computer cycling program (Zwift) and it's great. Just the right size. I can reach over and grab the keyboard and use it easily. Touch pad is responsive, as are keys. I have always had good results from buying any Logitech products. I would recommend this to anyone who doesn't want to have to use a mouse but needs a wireless keyboard with a built in touch pad that does what it is supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Messinger

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Entertainment PC
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, this is used in our living room for the TV PC. The track pad is great for not needing a mouse, and the left click button in the upper left corner is genius. you can hold it is stow hands and navigate with the pad. Two wish farm items: -- I wish is were back lit - but at the price point I'm not griping -- I also wish there were a scroll wheel in the upper loft corner as well. 5 stars because it accomplished exactly what I needed it to at a good price. Worked right out of the box with the windows auto installer. I will update if any problems arise down the road.
customer_reviews.author: PTG

customer_reviews.title: I have two wireless keyboards on my HTPC. One ...
customer_reviews.text: I have two wireless keyboards on my HTPC. One tiny one for when I'm just viewing content and this one for when I need to actually use it as a computer or type anything. This works well for that use case. My only complaint is that the Logitech software you have to install to program some of the features on the keyboard sticks you with a kind of weird pointer acceleration for the trackpad. Not a huge deal - you get used to it - but kind of off-putting when you don't use it too much.
customer_reviews.author: pdubs

customer_reviews.title: Model no longer works with Linux or Android mouse drivers
customer_reviews.text: For a long time, Logitech was my preferred maker of wireless keyboards. I've used several K400 keyboards through the years and been happy with size, layout, keys provided, responsiveness, and ease of use of the mouse trackpad. The mouse/trackpad of this version (I don't know why they keep using the same model number for different keyboards) does not work with Linux or Android drivers, so it's useless for most media center and NAS applications and useless to me. I happily used K400 keyboards with an Android TV box and an Android TV stick for years, so I don't know why they chose not to keep the driver compliance, but they've lost me as a customer until they bring it back.
customer_reviews.author: M. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Better than WisFox 2.4G Wireless Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: After using this keyboard for 4 years daily for my main desktop computer, it stopped working. I bought WisFox wireless keyboard to replace my old Logitech just because I wanted to try something new. WisFox and Logitech keyboards look very similar, so I expected WisFox keyboard would work like Logitech one. However, I immediately regretted, and I ordered my second Logitech keyboard. Logitech keyboard has a more sensitive touchpad than WisFox, which allow for smoother adjustment of the position of the cursor. With WisFox keyboard, I often had trouble moving the cursor and had to stroke my finger multiple times to finally be able to move the cursor. I am glad that I bought my second Logitech keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: IK

customer_reviews.title: Great Combo!
customer_reviews.text: Really like this keyboard, in fact, I'm typing this review on it now! Using for two HTPC setups. Only negative, doesn't denote a one star drop, is sometimes the volume buttons don't react (usually because of programs that are open). Very accustomed to touchpads as I have used laptops exclusively for years, and this touchpad is very good. Even responsive enough for me to casually game on! Keyboard is nice, not too small of keys but is noticeably different from laptop and especially desktop keyboards. Purchased the regular K400 from Logitech and was not impressed, returned due to issues with touchpad response and other things; got a second one of these as replacement!
customer_reviews.author: Murphy

customer_reviews.title: It stops working properly a lot.
customer_reviews.text: The nice thing about this keyboard is that can be used as a remote.But the overall quality of the product needs improvement.Sometimes it will show 20 letters on the screen even though I only typed the letter once.Sometimes the touchpad is still working but the keyboard is not.The worst thing happens when I push the delete button once and it start to delete all other folders and files nonstop from the hard drive I did not intend to delete.It's happened more than 3 times so far,and it cost me a lot of valuable data. This product helps when it's funtional,it works like a bad virus when it's not.
customer_reviews.author: AnAmazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Utter frustration - NO USB Adapter!!!
customer_reviews.text: Did not come with a USB adapter. There is a lovely place to store one under the battery cover. Can't really review the functionality of what I can't use. Funny thing is my wife ordered this one for me because she lost the USB adapter for my old one. Logitech was not responsive to my request for one, so now I have two useless Logitech wireless keyboards. Until now I was a big fan of Logitech hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Blacksatin

customer_reviews.title: Love this particular keyboard.  Very nicely designed
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is designed very nicely. Now I am relaxed on my chair and do not have to move my body. I can do all the movements on two monitors with this keyboard very comfortably. I loved the YELLOW left click mouse button on the top left corner. It has made moving and clicking very easy. I am writing this review by sitting on my chair leaning comfortably on the back, my feet are lean forward on a cushioned table and hands on the armrest. I could have not imagined that working with this keyboard will make such a difference and I like to congratulate the person who designed this keyboard. Highly recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer9..9

customer_reviews.title: Could Be Better
customer_reviews.text: It's a good wireless keyboard for various things. I wouldn't say this would be good for gaming. I bought it for a media center PC. I deduct one star for how easy it is to accidentally zoom when using the trackpad. Sometimes it will zoom by just putting pressure near the trackpad. Another issue is it's slippery. It slides off your lap so easy. I've dropped it so many times. It's light but it also feels cheap to me. It just feels like a hollow plastic shell, which is what it is but I feel like it would be better if it were a little heavier and the materials were stronger and didn't feel so plastic-y.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I brought the Logitech K400 Plus Wireless Touch keyboard for making PowerPoint presentation on a Smart TV. The connections are straightforward. Simply connecting the laptop to the TV using an HMDI cable. Plugging in the USB receiver that came with the keyboard to the laptop. Adjusting the TV to the HDMI port receiving the laptop signal. Turn on the wireless keyboard and. Now the Wireless keyboard has full control over the PowerPoint presentation on display on the TV. Please note that some TV has its own border space. It is advised to enlarge the images on the PowerPint to the edge so that you will be utilizing the full screen of the display.
customer_reviews.author: E. Nieh

customer_reviews.title: Touchpad has too many false signals
customer_reviews.text: I have the older non plus version which works well so ordered this when I wanted one for another HTPC. Far too often when trying to two finger scroll a web page it will intermittently send a zoom/pinch event instead (No matter how careful or vigilant you are about your finger spacing). So.. as you scroll down a web page all of a sudden you zoom in instead of scrolling. It makes the touch pad unusable for someone who does a lot of scrolling. There is not option to tell the keyboard not to send zoom/pinch events. In my opinion, that makes the product defective and not worth trying to use.
customer_reviews.author: Cindee

customer_reviews.title: Came with bad reciever
customer_reviews.text: Mine was sent with a bad receiver. It worked for a week but will still tend to disconnect after sitting untouched for a while. Then it kept getting worse, and eventually I couldn't connect at all on multiple devices. I went and got another logitech mouse with the unifying receiver, for around the same price as a receiver alone. When I tried that new one out, it connected instantly and has been working since. The keyboard itself is very good for its size and portability. The trackpad could be bigger though feels a bit imprecise. I use it for my home theater pc connected to my tv, which is the ideal scenario for this keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Great HTPC keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: We use this keyboard with our HTPC (home theater PC) and it is perfect for it. Our HTPC isn't very strong but it is perfect for streaming videos, web surfing and light office work. This keyboard works well all over our living room and allows us to do anything that we want. The trackpad is smooth and responsive. Unlike G Hub(Logitech's gaming software), the Logitech options software for this keyboard works well and has allowed us to customize a few F buttons. We also love the dedicated volume control keys above the trackpad.... super convenient!! We highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: ADAM NEAL

customer_reviews.title: Light Weight, Long battery life, works with, Linux, Windows, Android, some smart TVs, Vizio M55-D0
customer_reviews.text: The Logitech K400 is a solid purchase. I use it mainly on the couch with a living room PC running on Linux (Pop-OS). Works out of the box, completely plug and play plug and play on almost anything I plug the emitter into. Out of curiosity I plugged the emitter in the USB port of my Vizio M55-D0 smart TV and found that I can navigate around and type in search boxes an username/password request of any of the smart TV apps. So if your looking for a TV keyboard check the forums about your model. You might be surprised the it works. 4 stars (+1 for doing a little more than I expected).
customer_reviews.author: Incus

customer_reviews.title: My second one and it's still awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard does everything quite well. We have one of our Chromebooks plugged into our 75" TV. We use this Logitech keyboard with the Chromebook...it's so nice to be able to sit on the couch with just this handy keyboard on my lap instead of my laptop. I can now control everything from this keyboard...volume, search for anything I want, YouTube etc. SOOOOO CONVENIENT AND HANDY, we have another Logitech wireless keyboard on our treadmill also controlling another TV in front of the treadmill...full control over the laptop totally wireless, what's not to love!
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great portable keyboard when you aren't at your desk
customer_reviews.text: Best portable keyboard and trackpad. Great for using it on your lap when used with a PC home entertainment system or when you're traveling. At your desk, I suggest a heavier keyboard and regular trackball/mouse although I also use it at my desk too. Not optimal for fast paced games due to lag, probably to save power. I also have a logitech mouse with unifying receiver. If you have two unifying receivers in the same PC, it doesn't work well. I had to download and run Unifying Software so I could use one receiver for both this keyboard and mouse.
customer_reviews.author: TKS

customer_reviews.title: Ok for the price, random touchpad lag is annoying...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my HTPC build. Not the greatest when it comes to comfort and convenience, but then it's not a full sized keyboard so that was expected. What has annoyed me a bit is the touchpad responsiveness. It has a tendency to lag a lot randomly. I changed batteries to no avail. Even connected it to other PC's I have and I experienced the same random lag. It's not a deal breaker since I only use this on my HTPC, so it doesn't get as much usage as my other PC's, but it does get annoying when streaming video and I end up pausing or rewinding, etc inadvertently due to that lag.
customer_reviews.author: SP

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND! :)
customer_reviews.text: In love this keyboard is perfect especially since most are still working from home. This is very light weight and comfortable to use. The mouse pad is also on it so I no longer need to have a wireless mouse if I don’t want to have one and reach for it. I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS TO ANYONE LOOKING FOR A COMFORTABLE WAY TO TYPE. Also if you have a Logitech wireless mouse there is a way to connect both this keyboard and the mouse to only 1 USB receiver! ❤️ thanks Logitech
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect all-in-one keyboard. Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Well thought-out design. It's halfway like a game controller in that you can hold the whole thing on the sides and use your right thumb for the mouse movement and your left thumb on the yellow button to click (yes, that's a clicking button!). The keyboard covers all the regular functions I want in a keyboard. I got this in conjunction with a Chromebit and I LOVE the pairing! I've used this keyboard from 40ft away to run a Google Slides slideshow at a national training conference. It worked perfectly. Overall, it's somewhat small, but not problematic for me. The size is very convenient, as I'd expect this to be used more portably than for all-day-at-a-desk use. (helpful?)
customer_reviews.author: CChristopher

customer_reviews.title: Great!! Just Plug an Play on Samsung TV!
customer_reviews.text: Plug and play with Samsung TV! After reading some reviews of other wireless keyboards not working on Samsung TVs, I decided to buy this one. Just plugged the USB receiver to my TV and it works perfectly. Besides, the keys feel so good, and even when for some people it might be too big, for me it's the perfect size to avoid hitting more than one key at once.
customer_reviews.author: Esteban

customer_reviews.title: Cramped
customer_reviews.text: This product gets good reviews, and I will admit it's extremely easy to set up - truly plug and play. But I found the keyboard VERY cramped. I was frustrated that the image shown online isn't the product I received. For example, the image shows a full-size "return" key, but the keyboard I received has a very small return key that was hard to hit. The touchpad is also dull - I had to repeat actions to get it the cursor to move. It's really inexpensive, though, so I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: emmsf

customer_reviews.title: Loses signal - why does nobody mention this?
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe nobody else hasn't mentioned this loses signal, and loses it constantly. I tried TWO of these, on TWO different computers. They are literally (I measured) 10 feet away, and FOUR FEET AWAY. Yes, line-of-sight in both cases. I don't care what else I have in the room, interference shouldn't be this bad. It loses signal constantly, can't type without missing every 3 or 4 letters, and jumpy mouse control. This is my 2nd type of Logitech in as many years (3x total), and none have worked properly 100% of the time (not even 50% of the time).
customer_reviews.author: Ddesiign757fg

customer_reviews.title: Good buy, replaced laptop keyboard with this
customer_reviews.text: I spilled so much coffee on my laptop keyboard in the past year it crapped out on me. Debated between this keyboard and a folding one. Glad I got this very happy 10/10 Pros: nearly the same size of my 14" laptops keyboard good clicking feedback touchpad works, starts slowly switch between mouse and pad. lightweight played wow with it and the raid went well never had a lost signal even worked in next room over cons: no backlight sometimes I accidentally press f1 backspacing/returning the page i was working on
customer_reviews.author: S. D.

customer_reviews.title: It work with my Macbook Pro.
customer_reviews.text: This keyboards works for my 15" 2018 Macbook Pro, OS - High Sierra 10.13.6. Set-up is easy. It also works with my desktop computer using Windows 10 OS. It would be nice to change the speed of the track pad so the mouse courser moves faster, maybe I need to keep looking/researching how to do it. Otherwise it all works well.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: It's OK for light use
customer_reviews.text: Pros: It works and is convenient to use a single device from the couch. The touchpad supports pinch-to-zoom. Cons: The keys are smaller than standard, which makes it hard to type anything at length, and almost impossible for game playing. The up/down arrow keys are particularly hard to find and press by feel. The touchpad is pretty small and has a cheap feeling to it. I came from the solar-powered Logitech K-750 after the battery in it died. This keyboard is thicker and feels cheaper. The keys are smaller and it's comparatively unpleasant to use for gaming or doing much typing work. Still, it's OK for finding something on Netflix or YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: Curious

customer_reviews.title: You have to use a decent amount of pressure to ...
customer_reviews.text: You have to use a decent amount of pressure to type on these keys. I can type about 80 words a minute on my mechincal keyboard and I can't type 40 on this one. No instruction manual when I purchased it, as well as I couldn't find the USB dongle when I first ordered it. I watched a YouTube video on how to setup it up where I found where the dongle is in the packaging. I use mine for the computer I have hooked up to my tv so I can type from my recliner which is about 20 feet away from the TV and it seems to work from that distance.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Works great on both my Samsung TV and my PC
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my Samsung smart (ha!) TV, and alternately with my PC connected to that TV when I'm doing a lot of streaming that needs a browser, and don't want to use the pathetic Samsung browser. It is small without being a pain to type on, and the trackpad works better than many I've used. The trackpad responds to the multiple-finger commands well. In short, this kb seems to do everything I bought it do, and it does those things well.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: My laptop keyboard ended up failing in the middle of the COVID pandemic, so I ordered this keyboard to tie me over until the repair shops reopened. Honestly, it's a great keyboard. The touch pad on the side is a nice luxury to have-- I plug my laptop into the television during movie nights or gaming sessions now and can play/watch on the big screen. It's pretty neat! There is a slight lag with the bluetooth when gaming, I think, but given the RPG nature of the games I play I'm usually able to adapt to it. Overall a great $20 keyboard!
customer_reviews.author: Charizardlie

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive keyboard with a more than serviceable track pad!
customer_reviews.text: Great keyboard. The quality is superior to my original k400 keyboard with better battery life. The older model had bigger brighter lettering on the keys, however, until the letters wore off -- the reason I bought this new one. Also, the arrow keys are different. Up and down are half sized keys. I'd never seen that before. It took a little while to get used to it, but then, it's fine. For the most part, I like it better. The on;y design change I would make is larger, brighter letters on the keys. And short of illumination, day glow fluorescent letters might be nice too. As we all age, help with vision is always appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for purposes of having a wireless keyboard for my second laptop. Loving its compact size. Smooth and quick pairing with my laptops (two HPs). The touch pad is lively, and I actually like using it although I am usually a trackball kind of guy. I like that it has replaceable batteries, too. It is the perfect size for travel and to pack for use in hotel rooms. Great range since I sometimes project the laptop screen a room away to my living room TV. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Giles Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice for my media center needs
customer_reviews.text: I like the size, the typing comfort and the fact it is all in one. It types nicely, feels nice typing. I dislike the fact that the keys are dark and hard to see, there is no Caps lock light or any light showing it is on or off. Overall, i like it. For gaming i have a wireless mouse that i use in conjunction with this. For just browsing and streaming this is very nice. I will put glow in the dark stickers to label the keys so i can use this easier in the dark. Overall the typing was the important factor for me, it feels good to type on.
customer_reviews.author: Jaxsey X. Wells

customer_reviews.title: The best of its kind, period.
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak highly enough of these logitech keyboards. Amazing products that become a staple to so many setups. Get this if you need a portable solution for a mouse and keyboard. I recommend these to everyone searching for something similar, such as a teacher in a classroom using a computer and projector. I have one for a chromebit with only a single usb port. I have one for my tv, which uses a small computer to run windows. The possibilities are endless, and the battery life seems to be as well. Excellent range and durability. My toddlers have dropped ours more times than i can count, but they keep on trucking.
customer_reviews.author: wife

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great USB wireless keyboard with trackpad for my Windows 10 PC. I initially had a few issues with the proper driver loading for it in Windows 10 but ever since the Win10 update about a month ago, this keyboard has been nothing but perfect. Small sleek design with excellent responsiveness.
customer_reviews.author: Steve R

customer_reviews.title: It's a KNOCK OFFF. WARNING
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with little research. This is a knock off! Warning! The quality is very cheap. Mine does work, the touch pad is a bit lacking but usable but please do not buy. The seams are also separating. Look at the logo on the box and on the keyboard. Go to Logitech's website and look at there packaging and keyboard. It looks different, the logo. I owned a real K400 Plus by Logitech several years ago but lost it so I wanted to buy again... the real one was great quality. WARNING. KNOCK OFF.
customer_reviews.author: RadioKaos

customer_reviews.title: Habit Forming
customer_reviews.text: Eighteen months of daily use, including this review, and 'K400 Professional' still performing perfectly as expected (and get from All Logitech products). The extra 'Right Click' button located in the upper-left of the keyboard will absolutely become a habit (maybe an addiction). And the audio buttons above the touchpad are convenient. As it should be the F-keys on this 'Professional' version are directly accessible with no need to use the function key. Never had any issue with the wireless connection -- perfect as if it was corded. Have actually used it for gaming, including action & FPS, and though prefer full-size corded for such this worked very well. Expect my fingers will give out before these keys. Very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Intelli Gent

customer_reviews.title: Terrible battery life, avoid
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard is terrible. When the batteries are brand new, I would give it about 3 stars because it misses enough keystrokes that it's noticeable and annoying but manageable. The main problem is that is drains batteries way too fast, and no, I didn't forget to turn it off when I was done. I use the keyboard for maybe 30 minutes total each week, and the batteries die faster than anything else we own, eg, Xbox controller, remote controls, and cat toys.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: earned it's keep
customer_reviews.text: When we first got it we thought it was kinda dinky but now that we've had it for a few months, I'm a fan. We have our pc hooked up to our TV so we are always passing this keyboard around. Works fine as a keyboard on any surface and I like that it's light enough that I can just hold it with both hands, like say, a tablet, and use my thumb to control the mouse. We honestly weren't expecting much out of it but it's turned out to be a great little keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Pony-Float

customer_reviews.title: Works great on Raspberry Pi and on media center PC
customer_reviews.text: This keyboard has great range. I have two of them: one I use on my Raspberry Pi projects; the other one on my media center PC connected to the TV. The keyboard is at least 5-10 feet from the PC and TV with no loss of connectivity. Both Windows and LInux (Raspian for the Pi) have the drivers for the USB receiver built in so there is no need to search on the Internet for drivers. If you forget to turn it off, it goes to sleep to conserve the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: good keyboard for xiaomi TV box my dad uses
customer_reviews.text: i have a normal k400 for home use. my dad uses a xiaomi set top box at his house but does all of the typing with a remote which i thought was terrible so i got him one of these for christmas since i saw it on sale for cyber monday. He said it has drastically improved his quality of life so i'm taking that as a thumbs up for compatibility. he did not say anything about if the mouse part works, so i can't confirm that.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Y. YuanTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Boyfriend loves it! He hooks up his desktop with his TV when he just wants to watch from his bed. Before he only had a wireless mouse and a wired keyboard that was under the TV. On our lazy days we'd rock-paper-scissors to see who would get up and type whatever we wanted to watch next. I bought this for his birthday and he loves it! I love it! Now we can stay lazy and no one has to get up to type stuff! It's wonderful. Also, when switches from his TV to his computer monitor he doesn't have to worry about untangling the wired keyboard to move it in front of his monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Cool keyboard
customer_reviews.text: It’s a decent wireless keyboard. I have another Logitech wireless keyboard with a touchpad which is just better. More responsive keys, power button, on/off switch in better location. Costed like $50 at the time. This one is half the price and does the majority of what the old one does. Some keys arent responsive but I must admit it’s a great sturdy build for the price. I would recommend for people looking for a cheap decent full sized wireless keyboard with touchpad.
customer_reviews.author: anthony gamboa

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect way to connect up to my Media computer in my living room (which is hooked to my flat screen). It is very responsive although I've not used it for gaming. No cords or wires. Tiny little receiver plugs into a USB port and was flawlessly "Plug and Play". It's lightweight and with the integrated touch-pad, means only one device that can sit on my lap or the coffee table. MUCH more responsive that another brand I had before.
customer_reviews.author: wrudd

customer_reviews.title: Great for all applicable applications!
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is light but sturdy although it is a hair cramped and the touchpad is responsive (also a bit small). Great interface for my Raspberry Pi Zero W, Apple Mac Mini (currently using as a media center PC, only drawback is I cannot turn off 'tap to click' in Mac OSX which is a bit annoying - have not looked into it but hoping there is an actual driver I can install that will allow this), and PC. Plug and play on all 3.
customer_reviews.author: Steve-o

customer_reviews.title: Works Well with LG TVs
customer_reviews.text: This keyboards worked well with my LG LCD TV, model 65UJ6540. Note that you must use the "search" function key instead of the search icon that is normally displayed on the TV. If you click on the search icon that is displayed, you cannot type into the search box with this keyboard. If, however, you press the search function key on the keyboard then you get a difference search box and you can type into that one with the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Not great as a regular computer keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit that I bought this keyboard for something other than it’s intended use. It was a cheap, compact option for remote work, so I thought I’d try it. I don’t love it. It’s glitchy - the mouse often lags, or clicks when I’m not clicking. The keyboard sometimes types characters I haven’t typed...it’s fine 80% of the time, but that 20% is annoying. I would return it; but amidst corona-cation the likelihood of getting another one delivered is 0, so I’ll cope. I wouldn’t buy again for this purpose though.
customer_reviews.author: P. Woods

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I don't write a lot of reviews but it's hard to say enough that's good about this keyboard. For our htpc at home we have been using this keyboard for 3 years and we have young kids. The range is great, the keyboard is very functional and I don't miss any sort of lighting. Also it's basically indestructible. Ours has been dropped beaten and nearly broken so many times and yet it survived and continues to work well over and over again. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sanjay P.

customer_reviews.title: Horrible. sleeps almost instantly causing double the keystrokes
customer_reviews.text: I hate this thing. logitech missed by a mile on this one. It sleeps and I'm not able to disable that. Every time I reach for it to hit a key nothing happens. I have to do it again because it sleeps. You can't disable this function. Worst keyboard I've ever used and just disfunctional. Even the design sucks. Every time you touch the mute button your finger touches the touchpad and content stops. Absolutely horrible design by children.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great with XBOX ONE
customer_reviews.text: We bought this when we couldn't find any chat pads due to covid19. Kids use it to chat with friends while playing a game. It also allows them some extra control in some of their favorite Roblox games. I have also used it to control my laptop from across the room. It took some getting used to, but it works well. The price is excellent. It does not appear to be a cheap piece of junk (which honestly was what I was expecting for the price).
customer_reviews.author: kpng

customer_reviews.title: A useful tool, not suggested for prolonged use
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a "utility" keyboard to use a difficult-to-access PC inside an arcade machine. Most of the time it's tucked away - it's small size makes this easy - and it's great to have the mouse and keyboard in one space when I need them. Obviously its small layout makes it difficult for any extended use, but my only actual complaint is that there's no way to turn on Fn lock. By default, the Fn keys are mapped to system functions like volume up and down, most keyboard have a way to turn this off, so Fn keys operate as Fn keys. Doing common inputs like alt+f4 require an additional uncomfortable button press.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for streaming from your couch
customer_reviews.text: I love this little keyboard/mouse combo. My son does too and he's 7. I would not recommend it for gaming as the mouse is a touchpad and simply put, doesn't work well for the quick reaction type games but for literally everything else, it's perfect. Especially if your computer is hooked too your TV and you use the internet to stream Netflix or Hulu or what have you. Perfect. I have put 1 set of batteries in it and never turn it off. I've had it for about 3 years now and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Hamrick

customer_reviews.title: Insufficient range, laggy touchpad.
customer_reviews.text: The box claims 33' range, and some others say it works that way in their reviews, but not for me. I found anything further than 5' away and it cut out too much. Even when right next to it the touchpad was laggy. I'd slowly drag my finger across the pad and the cursor would jerk and twitch across the screen like a bad remote desktop session. I tried it on different computers and even tried fresh batteries but the behavior remained the same.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle A. Munz

customer_reviews.title: It is functional but far from ideal for what I need.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason why I bought this KB is that several keys on my 15.6" laptop are non-functional and I cannot take this into a shop and leave it there for several days until it is fixed. I need my laptop everyday. But this keyboard is way too small for me, not just overall size but more critically the smallness of the keys, especially the special function keys. In my hands, it makes mistakes all day and night long, and it is very frustrating. If you are a tiny person with tiny hands it may work for you but not me, and I am not a large person. So functionally it works, but realistically it is frustrating for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ernest Heau

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, little keys on a tiny little keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: Tiny keyboard with tiny keys any controls. Love the idea, it's the execution that sucks. I work 1/2 at a client's office and 1/2 day or more in my home office. I needed a keyboard much like the one at the client's. Can't find the same brand. This one answers the requirement of a wireless, but the tiny "F"/number keys just don't make it. I don't want to hunt for auxiliary keys, I want them where I know they are. Sorry Logitech old friends you screwed the pooch on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Works great with PS4
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying Logitech wireless stuff forever. It's cheap and lasts basically forever. This one seems to be no different. Specifically bought this to try it out on PS4 for easy in game chat. Works perfectly. Very minor lag when typing. Not a big deal. Playstation makes you think you need some fancy keyboard, but this one works. This thing is small and light enough to just throw on the couch, but not so small its hard to type. Decent feedback from the keys when typing. Also basically silent when typing. My only gripe is that since this board doesn't have a back light, it's hard to see when typing. That's my own fault for being cheap. Great cheap keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: James JamesonTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Slightly undersized, but works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a fancier Logitech keyboard and separate mouse - and had nothing but problems; the mouse and the trackpad kept acting erratically, especially dragging things when I wasn't trying to. I was hesitant to buy another Logitech product, because of this, but the reviews - and Amazon's generous return policy - made me do it. The thing works great! There is a separate button (yellow at top left) that does the dragging, so no confusion with the trackpad. The keyboard is slightly undersized and the whole feel is just a little cheap (but for the price, great), so I gave it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Absent Minded Professor Chaos

customer_reviews.title: Sucks
customer_reviews.text: Two things: 1. It’s layout is small. Makes it very easy to mistype... unless you are used to a smaller keyboard. 2. It is not made well. The keys look and feel like they could pop off any minute. Compared to most any other keyboard I have used... this feels about the cheapest. I would not purchase this keyboard again. Much better off spending more money on the K830 (for track pad), or the other wireless backlit keyboard without one (don’t know the model). Both are MUCH better quality
customer_reviews.author: Griffin J

customer_reviews.title: Great, for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, really well made, great range. The keys are REALLY close together and small. Going to take getting used to. And some instructions on what the shortcut buttons do, and how to turn off "tap to click" which is a TERRIBLE FEATURE for any mouse pad imo. But it's overall size & weight are nice. Mayyyyyy replace it with a bigger model down the road, but logitech is a good brand and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: SrirachaHOT

customer_reviews.title: Better than the amazonbasics one
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an amazon basics keyboard that was so frustratingly bad at dropping keystrokes that it spontaneously broke itself in half. Somehow. No issues with this keyboard from a distance of 8-10 feet (across the living room). The touch pad isn't great, but it's better than nothing and supports multitouch (e.g., two finger scrolling). The construction is kinda cheap (creaky plastic that gives if you twist it) but it's cheap and works.
customer_reviews.author: Apollo

customer_reviews.title: logitech you did it again.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Plug and play. it's not intended for gaming or anything, but it's a great keyboard. Extremely light. Surprisingly responsive trackpad. Membrane keyboard, so it's nothing special there. It has media keys which is nice. Only complaint I have: the USB receiver has no external dock, so when you need to pack it up you have to take off the back battery panel and put it in the internal USB holder.
customer_reviews.author: Kaden

customer_reviews.title: The fixed the key layout!
customer_reviews.text: The older version of this keyboard is SOOOOO annoying with the shift/arrow keys in the lower right. I had to put that keyboard on our HTPC where it isn't used much and basically never used for two-handed typing, because the frustration level is so high I would go grab a wired keyboard if I had more than 60 seconds worth of typing to do. That's been fixed in this new version, you can actually use it for two-handed typing.
customer_reviews.author: B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a College Dorm room
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Daughter who is a freshman at college in a dorm. I had given her a HTPC for her room. She loved that it didn't have a separate mouse to keep track of. The order arrived at my place and on time. Never even opened and checked it out, I have had such great luck with Logitech, it never even crossed my mind. Gave it to her at her birthday part and explained it should be plug and play for the Windows 10 machine I had given her, but to call me if she had any issues. Later on, she told me it was super easy and she loves it, thanks!! Happy Daughter, happy Dad!
customer_reviews.author: AdicusTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: Very good keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my wife's TV. I like this keyboard so much I bought another one to replace the keyboard I use on another TV! The optional software is very handy and easy to customize the keyboard to meet your preferences. The yellow button is very convenient for your left thumb to click/select when operating the mouse with your right hand. Batteries last a long time and works great with rechargeable batteries too. The ONLY critique I can think of is when you hold down the backspace or delete button it only deletes one letter. To delete or backspace 10 letters you have to hit the button 10 times. You can't go wrong with Logitech, they make quality products.
customer_reviews.author: That Guy

customer_reviews.title: Decent keyboard
customer_reviews.text: Got this to use it with a raspberry pi. Works OK; the keys are large but the layout is not super friendly. Takes a lot to get used to the small return, and the smaller keys like backspace. Usable for a bit but considering how big it is; one was expecting a layout more serviceable. The trackpad is OK; I like the left button repeated also on the top left of the keyboard, so you don't have to get cramps to use the touchpad and click at the same time. Not really for gaming; the touchpad is too small and the keyboard is not really set for gaming either.
customer_reviews.author: CFTop Contributor: Star Trek

customer_reviews.title: Love diss.
customer_reviews.text: Man! This thing is so cool. You can hold it with one hand and do the mouse/type with the other if you're standing up! It has a huuuge range. I must have been a good 20 feet away from my Raspberry Pi that I plugged it into and I was able to type on it through a wall as well as being really far away. Nice key feel and the mouse has all the touchpad features you could want. Awesome buy, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Pashy

customer_reviews.title: Not Fantastic - Not Great - Just O.K.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this Keyboard with my Media PC which is connected to a 50" wall mounted TV. Keyboard works O.K. - - - - - - - - - - But 8 months into using it; the SPACEBAR only works half the time; and I keep noticing words jumbled together due to the space-bar missing its click. And the touch-pad is enough to drive you crazy because it is so dysfunctional. Update. I just lost a key because it fell-off while I was using the keyboard today. These Things Are Real Junk!!
customer_reviews.author: R.E.S..

customer_reviews.title: trouble-free
customer_reviews.text: It just works. No trouble getting this to work with Windows 10 on an Intel NUC7i5. Both the keys and the trackpad work in the UEFI boot menu. The up/down arrow keys are too small, but that's really my only complaint. I probably wouldn't use this for any work that involves a lot of typing, but it's fine for an HTPC. The trackpad works fine it's nice that there are physical keys for left/right mouse button.
customer_reviews.author: N.G.

customer_reviews.title: The world's worst touchpad
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love the idea of this keyboard, making it easy to control a PC at a distance. The issue is with the touchpad. It is probably the worst touchpad I have ever felt in my life. It is not slick, it does not feel good to use, and has accuracy/touch detection issues. So, honestly Logitech could have just cut this thing in half and I would have given the keyboard section a much better review.
customer_reviews.author: MathewRD

customer_reviews.title: Great size, built well, but have some lag when using the touchpad
customer_reviews.text: The keyboard is the perfect size for what I needed it for. I have it plugged up to a laptop that's connected to my living room TV. Hooking it up was as easy as plugging the USB dongle in and powering on the keyboard. It even came with batteries. The reason I'm knocking one star off is because there is some noticable lag when using the touchpad on the keyboard. Not a crazy amount but enough for it to be noticable. Other than that it seems to be working really well and seems to be of good build quality!
customer_reviews.author: A. Stream

customer_reviews.title: Not Compatible with Apple Products
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this because my 13 year old will be distance learning again this fall and will have the laptop on an elevator to prevent neck strain. Very disappointed to discover this keyboard is not compatible with Apple products, only Windows, Chrome and Android. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa A. Weisman

customer_reviews.title: Consistency in Operation
customer_reviews.text: The cordless keyboard really had me excited in the beginning. Shortly after (a few months), it stopped responding to the key commands. It'd you experience this, I recommend you check with customer support as soon as it first happens. So, I give it a 4 star rating on it's performance before it started to malfunction. If there Are any suggestions that can be recommend to help me with something that I overlooked, this would be greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Small, Portable, Good Distance
customer_reviews.text: I have been using one of these for years to swap between headless systems (Raspberry Pis), but recently it became a permanent accessory to our Nintendo Switch, so now I've ordered this second one for my system maintenance needs. The switch and TV is about 14 feet away from where we sit, and we've never had any typing issues. The off switch on the back is important, batteries won't last two days if it isn't turned off.
customer_reviews.author: G. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Update
customer_reviews.text: Update: I wasn't able to update my review for some reason but can now. The USB adapter is packed in a weird way near the opening of the box. Also, it's excellent! Came missing it's usb adapter. Will update review if replacement contains all necessary parts to enable operation.
customer_reviews.author: Beck and Gund

customer_reviews.title: Good Range
customer_reviews.text: This takes 2 AA batteries instead of 2 AAA batteries. That means it has greater range. I don't use this for the desktop. I use this for my living room. This is why range is important. The touch pad on the right, and the extra left mouse button on the upper left (yellow button), means I can hold it with both hands, operate the touch pad with my right thumb, and click with my left thumb.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Boom

customer_reviews.title: Would only recommend for applications of occasional or very light use or ...
customer_reviews.text: As any Logitech build quality is on par with their other products. I've had no issues with connectivity or keys not functioning that I've experienced with other wireless products. I currently use this about 10 feet from the computer it's plugged into. My only real complaint is it is a bit smaller than I expected and a bit hard to type on until you get used to it. But for a quick keyboard to access a HTPC it has worked out well. Would only recommend for applications of occasional or very light use or maybe even travel. But would not recommend for everyday use and I don't think that is even the intention of the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: TheDroidYou'reLookingFor

product_meta.title: Logitech K400 Plus Wireless Touch TV Keyboard with Easy Media Control and Built-In Touchpad
product_meta.description:
Style:PLUS| Pattern Name:Single

Control your computer-enabled TV from the comfort of your couch without the need for a mouse. The K400 Plus Wireless Touch TV Keyboard allows you to navigate seamlessly with its built-in track pad.

The keyboard enables you to work wirelessly up to a range of 10 m or 33 ft without having to move around. It’s large enough for most family dens and living rooms.

The K400 has media-friendly controls and a familiar key layout so you can easily navigate without the hassle of a regular remote control. 

 Forget complex setup procedures. Connect the K400 to your computer or TV with a single wireless connection using the Logitech Unifying receiver. Plug it into the USB port, and you’re ready to go. The Unifying receiver also allows you to connect multiple Logitech devices at the same time. 

 There’s no need for continuous charging with the K400’s 18-month battery life. You can use the keyboard for longer without worrying about replacing batteries. When it’s time to replace them, you quickly pop in 2 more AA batteries, and you’re ready to go again.
